dialogues.text: Mrs. Whitehall's funeral.     Did you find it interesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was OK I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are all funerals the same?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Jack. They're never the same. Each one is special. The dead always speak to us in different ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot finished arranging the flowers.     He glances at h watch. Smiles at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a pleasure talking to you Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's intrigued.   He watches Eliot walk out of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eliot heads to the Prep Room, we hear a MUFFLED CRASH from inside. Eliot quickly pulls out his keys. Moves to the door. Just then Eliot hears a creaking sound behind him. He turns. Jack's at the top of the stairs. Staring down curiously at the Prep Room door. Eliot observes him cautiously. Did Jack hear the sound as well? Jack looks back at Eliot. Smiles. Then without a word, turns and heads back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sits on the floor in the middle of the room. Hugging her legs to her chest. Rocking to and fro. Surrounded by broken glass, torn papers and instruments. Eliot enters the room. Coldly surveys the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna ignores him.   Eliot strides over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHY DID YOU DO THIS?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stares at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the afterlife?    Am I in heaven? Or am I in hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangely Eliot's not surprised.   He nods his head.   Hi anger gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a door. Just there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be long now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to believe in God. I thought I'd see him when I died. Instead I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot softly strokes her hair.    Comforting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you are God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be at peace soon.     I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment we see a deep sadness in Eliot's eyes. He's conflicted. But then abruptly he pulls himself together. Moves away and starts clearing up. Anna closes her eyes. Hugs her legs closer to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets out a DESPONDENT SIGH.   The SIGH carries into the next scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tall trees stand motionless amongst the graves. A sudden GUST OF WIND bends the dense foliage. Their leaves ripple. Languid and fluid like a wave. RUSTLING EERILY. The sound almost malevolent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's red-rimmed eyes snap open. He lies on his bed fully clothed. An empty bottle of bourbon on the bedside table. Behind him the curtains stir. The KITSCHY DOLL'S head begins to slowly nod. Turning towards us. We hear the eerie rustling sound again. Like a MURMURING WHISPER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns quickly. Sees the open window. It's only the wind. He shivers. It suddenly got very cold. He gets up and closes the window. The WHISPERING starts again. This time from the bathroom. Paul walks over to the bathroom door. As he touches the door handle... the whispering STOPS. Paul hesitates. The room's strangely silent. He slowly opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. The bathroom's empty. Paul looks around nervously. He catches the reflection of his pallid face in the mirror. Leans wearily against the washbasin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water DRIPS from a leaky pipe. The fluorescent bulb over the mirror CRACKLES softly. Paul turns on the taps. Splashes cold water on his face. He's about to reach for a towel when he senses something. He cocks his head slightly. A feeling. He turns and checks out the bathroom. Nothing. Paul dries his face. As he replaces the towel... the sound of dripping water ABRUPTLY STOPS. Silence. Suddenly the SHOWER STARTS RUNNING. Paul's paralyzed with fear. Steam wreathes the room in a cloud of vapor. He turns slowly towards the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stands in front of the shower with her back to him. She slips off her bathrobe and hangs it on a hook. Then her hand moves to her chest. There's a STRANGE WET SUCKING sound... ...as Anna rips out her heart and hangs it casually on the hook next to her bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STILL BEATING HEART
dialogues.text: dripping crimson blood onto the bone white tiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna turns slowly. Her skin's like alabaster. Unnaturally translucent. A bloody gash where her heart used to be. The steam from the shower curls around her like a mist. She looks hauntingly beautiful. Mesmerizing. A line of thick black fluid trickles from her nose. Paul turns away. Horrified. When he turns back a second later Anna's not there. The bathroom's empty. The shower's not even running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack opens the fridge. It's almost empty. He takes out a carton of milk. Sniffs it. Recoils from the smell. From the living room we hear the LOUD sound of a TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!    We're out of milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reply.      Jack grabs his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's still sitting on the floor. The place is clean and ordered again. She watches Eliot unzip a garment bag. He lifts out a plain black dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your dress. For your funeral. Your mother brought it round this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eliot takes out a pair of shiny black shoes from a plastic bag, Anna moves haltingly over to the dress. She touches the material puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't my dress. (realizes with shock) This is my mother's dress! It was supposed to be for her funeral. Why has she given it to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot starts folding the plastic bag. He notices something else inside. He opens the bag. Hesitates then takes something out.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELIOT'S HAND
dialogues.text: An old-fashioned wooden rosary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks at it for a moment. Then glances over at Anna. She's still staring at the dress. He opens a drawer beneath the counter. It's full of rosaries and printed Holy cards. He quickly drops the rosary into the drawer. Closes it. Then turns back to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should have been her not me. (turns to Eliot) She was the one dying. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot unlocks the door. Jams it open with a door stop. Slips his keys back into his jacket pocket. Takes off his jacket and hangs it up. He moves over to a collapsible gurney folded on the floor. Bends down and snaps open the side-rails. Anna looks at the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks up at Anna sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you still struggling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready to die.   Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at the open door again.    Eliot follows her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing out there for you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eliot turns back to the gurney, Anna notices Eliot's jacket hanging beside her. Realizes the KEYS are in the pocket. She quickly glances back at Eliot. He's still busy adjusting the gurney. She leans over to his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he gets up and turns to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks at him calmly. We can't tell if she managed to get his keys or not. Eliot pulls on his jacket and wheels the gurney through the door. He steps back into the room. Nudges the door stop away with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door locks behind him with a CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot pushes the gurney to a WHITE VAN with black tinted windows (Note: The same kind of van that cut in front of Anna just before the accident).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna listens anxiously to the CRUNCH of Eliot's feet on the gravel outside. After a moment she hears the van drive away. She unfurls her fist revealing Eliot's keys.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ELIOT'S VAN. STREETS
dialogues.text: As Eliot slides in a CD he notices the fuel gauge. He's low on gas. He glances into his rear-view mirror and makes a left turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna staggers to the door. There's at least a dozen keys. She frantically chooses one and shoves it into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begging the door to open) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't fit. She's panicking. She fumbles for another key. It almost fits. She forces it. The key SNAPS OFF LOUDLY in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks around desperately. Sees a tray of instruments on the steel trolley. She scrambles over. Finds a pair of surgical pliers. She moves back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot replaces the pump nozzle.   Walks over to the cashi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-four fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. Jack, a carton of milk in his hand, steps out of the gas station. Eliot doesn't notice him as he pulls out a roll of notes. Hands over two twenties. Then he frowns. Something's wrong. He checks his pockets again. He can't find his keys. He walks quickly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.   Your change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot ignores him. Scrambles into his van. Intrigued, Jack watches Eliot drive away. Then unlocks his bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's still trying to pry out the broken key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ELIOT'S VAN. STREETS
dialogues.text: Eliot's at a red light. Drumming his fingers in frustration as he waits for the light to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Anna pulls out the broken key. Quickly chooses another. Turns it gently. Again it doesn't fit. Anna's hysterical now. She tries the next key. It fits! She's stunned for a second. Then pulls open the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ELIOT'S VAN. STREETS
dialogues.text: Eliot turns sharply into a small road by the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna staggers to the front door. She pulls at the door. It won't open. Frantically she finds the key. Unlocks the door, leaving the keys in the lock. As she opens the door HEADLIGHTS sweep across the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot's van pulls up in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's trapped. We hear the CRUNCH of Eliot's footsteps on the gravel outside. Anna looks round desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot reaches the front door. It's slightly ajar.   He pushes it open. Steps warily inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks around. The entrance hall's empty.   Then he notices the keys in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. Anna pulls at the back door. It won't budge. She panics. Sees a kitchen knife on the counter. Quickly grabs it. As she steps back, she knocks over a metal bucket. The sound's DEAFENING in the silent house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot hears the NOISE. Smiles. He calmly locks the door and puts the keys into his pocket. Moves down the hallway towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot switches on the light.   The kitchen's empty.    He steps back into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands very still.    Watching.   Waiting.   We pull b

dialogues.speaker: JUST AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Anna pushes herself against the wall clutching the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot turns towards her... then at the last moment changes his mind. Heads in the opposite direction towards the viewing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot steps carefully into the viewing room. Looks around. Just then we hear the sound of bare feet STAMPING along the hallway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna runs to the front door. It's locked. She glances around anxiously. Sees a staircase leading upstairs. She weakly stumbles up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna walks along the corridor. She peers into a room. Notices a TELEPHONE on a table. She moves over to the telephone. The door CREAKS closed behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot hears the CREAKING DOOR upstairs.    He cocks his head upwards. Straining to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna frantically punches the buttons on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telephone RINGS in the empty kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna rocks back and forth as she anxiously listens to the RINGING on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please pick up. Please pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot slowly climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone continues to RING. We pull back. Paul stares at the phone blankly. A drink in his hand. He looks worse than before. Dark circles under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna glances back to the door in panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.   Please pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Paul reaches across and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna cups her hand around the mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul. I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's HOARSE DISTORTED VOICE sounds almost malevolent. Paul's stunned. He stares at the phone as if it was possessed. Then slowly puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks at the phone in disbelief. The MONOTONOUS TONE DRONES in the ear piece. She doesn't notice Eliot appear in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the light comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only one who can hear you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna drops the phone. Backs away towards a window.      E walks over and calmly replaces the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be very careful if I were you. The dead have such a hold over the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods to the phone) He still feels your presence. You're only causing him more pain. If you really loved him, you'd accept your death and let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then prove to me I'm really dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people.   You always need proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot places his hands on her shoulders.    Turns her towards a tall mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PALE CADAVEROUS WOMAN. Sunken eyes.      A blood-staine tear in the side of her RED SLIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's stunned. She moves closer to the mirror.      Touc her reflection through a thin layer of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I look like a corpse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you are a corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stares blankly at her image in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time you finally accepted the truth. You are dead. You will never live again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot smiles. Like a father proud of his child's first step. Just then he notices something outside. We see a brief flicker of unease in Eliot's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands in the driveway holding his bicycle.    Looki up at the Funeral Home. Transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna in her RED SLIP by the mirror. She looks frightening in the harsh light. Deathly pale. Like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangely Jack isn't scared. He continues staring up at the window. Calmly. Curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot coolly turns back to Anna. She hasn't noticed Jack. Still staring at her reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stares at the telephone. After a moment he slowly pulls the telephone plug out of the wall. Mechanically grabs a plastic bin liner from underneath the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens the wardrobe. Pulls out Anna's clothes. Stuffs them into the bin liner. He notices the Kitschy Doll. Shoves it in with Anna's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna lies on the slab. She stares at us blankly. Her face emotionless. Resigned. Eliot rinses her hair now dyed back to brown. She slowly closes her eyes. CLOSE ON RED DYE draining into the sink. Eliot picks up the scissors. Carefully slices open Anna's red slip. Delicately peels the slip off her body. Anna doesn't react. CLOSE ON Anna. She opens her eyes. Confused.     She turn her head... she's in PAUL'S BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul lies in bed next to her watching her intently.     H looks different. Clean shaven. Sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dead. I had a car accident.     Did you ever dream you were dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't reply.    She turns... the bed's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks up. Paul's in the doorway.    She gets up. Suddenly the light goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light comes back on.   Paul stands by the light switc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts his finger to his lips) Ssh. Don't talk so loud. You'll wake the neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's getting nervous.    Something's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What neighbors? You don't have any neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he looks at her reproachfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever love me Anna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Anna's face.    She looks away guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna closes her eyes.    Unable to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.     Say you love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we hear the strident ringing of a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to pick it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   No.    It's probably for Eliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's eyes snap open in shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stands over her. We're back in the PREP ROOM.   We hear the faint ringing of a phone from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it always like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought when you died you wouldn't feel anything. You wouldn't feel any more pain. You wouldn't have to struggle anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it just doesn't stop does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs the phone keeps on ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot takes notes as he talks on the phone. He looks at a day calendar on his desk. Idly flips over the page from Tuesday to Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It's no problem at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick up the deceased from the hospital. Yes. This afternoon? That'll be fine. It's my pleasure Mr. Merano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAY BODIES lie on steel tables. Eliot moves over to one of the CORPSES. Examines it with professional interest. Just then the Old Guy walks in with the Pale Assistant pushing a gurney with a BODY wrapped in plastic sheeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here he is. Frank Merano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Guy hands Eliot a clipboard. The Assistant unties the rope. Pulls the plastic sheeting away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (40s), the top half of his head has been flattened. His head split open. Grotesquely distorting his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.   That had to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot glances at the Assistant with disdain. Signs the release form and hands the clipboard back to the Old Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stands by a PRINCIPAL as they watch a JANITOR snap off the padlock on Anna's locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you to sort out her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Principal and Janitor walk away. Paul reaches inside the locker. Pulls out a stack of exercise books. An empty pills bottle. Then he notices something in the back of the locker. He pulls it out. It's a PHOTOGRAPH of Paul and Anna together on vacation. Smiling. Happy. Paul looks at it for a moment. Trying hard to hold back his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEAFENING NOISE of schoolchildren.    Paul weaves his way through the crowded corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Jack. Miss Bryant was my teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks at Jack coldly for a second.    Then walks awa Jack follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going past the funeral home. Miss Bryant stood there. In the window. In a red dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna doesn't have a red dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm lying.   I'm not lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stops.   Turns to Jack angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... (trying to remember his name) Jack. I'm in no mood--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. Anna's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's words ECHO loudly.   The bustling corridor goes si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) I can't help her anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns and walks away.    Jack grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you just don't love her anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns and hits Jack with the back of his hand.     J falls to the ground. Paul stands over him enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little fuck. You think this is funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to hit Jack again when a STOCKY TEACHER grabs him. Paul tries to struggle loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHILDREN stare at Paul. A SECURITY GUARD runs across talking into a walkie-talkie. Another TEACHER bends down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods numbly. Looking up all the time at Paul.      T Security Guard grabs Paul's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul watches Jack stand shakily.   Realizes what he's done. He reaches out to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack... I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits at a table. Staring blankly at a row of CCTV monitors. The door opens. Tom walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not pressing charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't look up.     He's miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's wrong with you? (holds his fingers close together) You're this close to fucking up your career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly looks up) You know what he told me? He told me Anna's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't believe him did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's relieved. Paul turns back to the monitors.     The ghostly figure of a YOUNG FEMALE TEACHER drifts hypnotically across the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... I'm having these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot leans over Frank's body on the slab. Rolling a ball of wax in his hands to warm it up. He gently moves Frank's head to one side. In the b.g. Anna lies on her slab watching Eliot work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares back at her with open dull eyes. His face partially reconstructed with plaster of Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot smooths the wax over the plaster to give Frank's face a more natural texture. Then picks up a piece of wire with a fishhook-like barb at each end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks up surprised. Anna stands beside him. leans down. Peels back Frank's upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mouth.   To keep it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot imbeds one barb into the upper gum then pries back Frank's lower lip. He attaches the other barb into the lower gum, then twists the wires tightly together. He picks up two plastic caps covered in small knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inserts the caps into Frank's eyes. Pulls his eyelids over them. Glues the eyelids together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this how you'll prepare my body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks at her for a moment.   Smiles reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There's no need. I had to rebuild his face. You're still beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    A brother. He's coming in later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna touches the white sheet covering Frank's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother... She didn't cry did she? When she came to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not important anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    He didn't cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a brief flicker of pain in Anna's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew he wouldn't.     He always got upset when I cried.     He said crying never helped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna suddenly looks very weary. She leans heavily against the slab. As if she's about to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He guides her back to the slab.    Helps her lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting weaker.    It's almost time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot strokes her hair tenderly.    She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To make life important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's fingers curl around his hand. Like a vulnerable child. Totally trusting in him. Eliot looks down at Anna sadly. We sense he's conflicted. Confused. Wavering. But then reluctantly he reaches for a SYRINGE filled with AMBER LIQUID on the steel trolley. He injects her gently in the neck. Watches over her for a moment. Then moves to the window. He picks up a window pole. Pulls the shutter across the window plunging the room into darkness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot moves through the Funeral Home pulling heavy drapes over the windows and closing doors. It feels like a ritual. The once airy sunlit rooms are darker now. More ominous. Claustrophobic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a stream of crystal blue water.    We pull back. Eliot picks up a white towel. Dries his hands. Deep in thought. He moves to his desk. Picks up a Polaroid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman, Mrs. Whitehall, lying in her casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whitehall. Susan. I hope you found what you were looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Eliot looks up sharply.   As if someone had spok to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think nothing of it Mr. Houseman.    No need to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot moves over to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really enjoyed our time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back slowly. Eliot's talking to a POLAROID of an OLD MAN. We pull back further... the wall's covered in HUNDREDS OF POLAROIDS of BODIES in open coffins. Most of them have closed eyes but we glimpse some with their eyes wide open. Eerily staring at us. Eliot touches the Polaroid of a YOUNG MAN. We see the fear in the Young Man's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony.    Anthony. Always confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then we hear the doorbell ringing downstairs.    Eli moves to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE OFFICER stands at the front door.    A SQUAD CAR parked on the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot steps back.    Calmly continues to dry his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot leads the Police Officer through the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you Officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stops.   We see a brief flicker of unease in his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Merano. I'm his brother.    Vincent Merano? I called this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Merano.   Yes. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's no trouble. I'd just like to see him before the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot glances at his watch.   Smiles at Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no trouble at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot leads Vincent to Frank's covered body. Vincent looks over at Anna. The white sheet only comes to her shoulders, her head facing straight upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent turns back to Eliot. We're not sure if Eliot was speaking to Frank or to Vincent. Eliot pulls the sheet away. Frank's face is flawless. No sign of any damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks so peaceful. You've done a beautiful job. Thank-you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should remember him as he used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we hear a FAINT RUSTLING sound. Vincent glances again at Anna's body. Her head is now turned to one side. Wasn't she facing upwards a moment ago? Vincent's puzzled for a second then shrugs. Must have been his imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the schoolteacher isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot pulls the sheet over Anna's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Very tragic. Now is there anything else I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent frowns.   Turns back to Eliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's not right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up sharply) Not right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent nods towards Frank's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His smile.    It was a bit more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent raises his fingers to his mouth, trying to find the right word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...smiley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: Eliot manipulates Frank's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A touch more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's much better. Thank-you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I have a couple of minutes alone with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot hesitates.      Then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Not at all. I'll wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eliot leaves, Vincent looks at Frank's body. After a moment he glances at Anna again. Then at the door. He quickly moves over to Anna. Looks at her curiously then pulls down the sheet. He reaches over... and CARESSES HER BREAST. Mesmerized by her naked body. As Vincent's hand moves down her body, he bumps against the trolley. Instruments CRASH to the floor. He pulls back the sheet just as Eliot enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.    I didn't see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot notices the sheet covering Anna's body is slightly askew. He reaches over and straightens it. Then looks coldly at Vincent. There's an uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I guess I should be off then. I'll see you at the service. Thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent glances one last time at Anna then leaves. The door locking shut behind him. Eliot stares at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you. That was your brother. (turns to Frank) You had an accident. You're dead. Why do you people never listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank doesn't move.    His mouth still wired shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It's not a gift.   It's a curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot picks up a compact. Roughly layers Frank's cheeks with thick rouge. With every word he gets more agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take care of each of you as if you were my children. I wash the shit from your bodies. I dress you. I do everything to make you look more beautiful than when you were alive. And what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot's extremely irritated now.     He grabs a garish re lipstick. Smears Frank's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You argue with me. As if it were my fault you're dead. As if I was to blame. (slams down the lipstick.) What? You're not talking to me now? You don't want to?

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK'S FACE
dialogues.text: The crudely drawn bright red lips.     Clown-like circles rouge. Gaudy and macabre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't talk because you have nothing to say. And you have nothing to say because you're a corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Eliot's reaction it seems as if Frank has started to talk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Now I don't want to talk to you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains are drawn. Jack's Mother, still motionless, in front of the blaring TV. Jack stops in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off to school now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother doesn't reply. Jack leaves. After a moment she slowly turns her head. Stares at the empty doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack cycles through the cemetery. He pulls up by a bush. Stares at the Funeral Home in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service hasn't started yet. Jack walks nervously through the empty room to an open casket. He glances back, then leans over the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Merano lies nestled in the velvet interior.    His face placid. No sign of the gaudy make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares in fascination at Frank's body. He reaches into the casket. Touches Frank's cold hand. In the b.g. Eliot walks into the viewing room.     He sto surprised. Watches Jack intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like? Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns quickly.    Eliot stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have empathy with the dead. You're drawn to them. Just as they're drawn to you. It's a rare gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack can't look Eliot in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you saw Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hesitates.   Then nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're frightened by it. I was scared too the first time. But you shouldn't be. Christ had the same gift. He raised Lazarus and spoke to the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spoke to Miss Bryant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've spoken to others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Many others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the first one you spoke to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks up sharply.   Eliot's words have clearly struc chord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others. They won't understand.    They don't see what we see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you. I can teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stares vacantly at the ceiling. Eliot places a bunch of tulips on the trolley. Turns on a CD. CLASSICAL MUSIC fills the room as before. He moves over to Anna. Gently Pulls away the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fingernails are dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot smiles.    Examines his nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands are normally so clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been gardening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the sink.      Scrubs his nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it sunny outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot fills a bowl with water.     Carries it to the slab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    The tulips love the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna glances up at the shuttered window. Eliot snaps on his latex gloves. Picks up a sponge and wets it in the bowl of water. Anna turns to the tulips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they your favorite flower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulips?    Yes. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot raises Anna's arm. Delicately washes her armpit. Along the length of her arm. Her skin pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it'd be lilies. White lilies. Don't they symbolize death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    They symbolize purity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to her breasts, following the contours of her body. Pausing every now and then to rinse the sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tulips?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot hesitates for a second before replying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unrequited love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your favorite flower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot softly washes her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful flower.       They need shade and lots of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they symbolize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faithfulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot puts down the sponge.      Dries her body with a to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roses are red, violets are blue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches over to the CD player to switch it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     Leave it on.    It's so peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot smiles.   Leaves the music on.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PAUL'S CAR. STREETS
dialogues.text: Paul drives aimlessly past strip malls. He stops at a red light. Lights a cigarette. Just then he notices something across the street. He looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gets out of his car.    Quickly walks over to the store window.

dialogues.speaker: ON STORE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A RED-SLIP on a mannequin.       Just like ANNA'S RED SLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light's turned green. The DRIVERS HONK angrily. Paul doesn't hear them. He places his hand against the plate glass. Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot prunes a low hedge by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot turns.   Paul's clearly agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran.   A pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stands stiffly.   Rubs his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love gardening, but I'm not sure gardening loves me anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not dead is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Anna's students. (nods towards the funeral home) In the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's momentarily taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I know him. He's often round here. He seems to have a strange fascination with death. He's eleven years old Mr. Conran. And like all young boys has a vivid imagination. Now if you'll excuse me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he imagined it.   I think he really saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you just want to believe he saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes past Eliot and strides into the Funeral Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul moves quickly through the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot calmly heads towards Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran. I think you should leave before I call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul notices the stairs leading down to the Prep Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul runs over to the Prep Room door. He grabs the handle It's locked. Eliot appears behind him. Paul turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in here isn't she?     Give me the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stares at Paul with pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the fucking key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns back.   POUNDS the door in rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POUNDING echoes through the room. Anna awkwardly sits up. Struggling with her emotions. She wants to call out but knows she has to let Paul go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna gets up.   Hesitates.   Weakly stumbles to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Please Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places the palm of his hand against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna places her palm against the door. As if touching Paul's hand. A tear falls down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be happy again. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't live without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks up at Paul with sudden interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna shakes her head. Takes her hand away from the door. Walks back to her slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot gently puts his hand on Paul's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran.   She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're going through. Denial's a natural part of grieving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna lies down on the slab. Closes her eyes.     ELIOT'S VOICE seems far away now. Receding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you've got to accept she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't help her anymore.    Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open plan office. Paul weaves quickly through the rows of desks. He seems unbalanced. Manic. DETECTIVES cautiously watch Paul approach Tom sitting at his desk, his head bent over paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to issue a search warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks up.       He's shocked by Paul's appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a fucking search warrant.    Now are you going to help me or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF (20s) a Young Detective at a nearby desk stands. Tom nods to him. It's under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul.    Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hesitates for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit.    Down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits.    Tom leans forward.    He's not amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing? I got a call from Eliot Deane. Are you out of your fucking mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's not dead Tom. He won't let me see her. He's keeping her there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna was in a car accident. Her car was wrecked Paul. Remember? It's downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom calmly gets up. Moves to a filing cabinet.   Takes out a file. Hands it to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the Coroner's report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul manically rifles through the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. (shows file to Tom) The paramedics phoned it in. They only checked for eye dilation and pulse. The doctor signed the death certificate without even seeing her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?   That's standard procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no EEG. Nothing. He could have drugged her to make it look like she was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugged her?     Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks up eagerly from his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are drugs like that chief. Hydronium Bromide. Total paralysis within seconds. The heartbeat slows to almost nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shoots Jeff a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I'm telling you. She's not dead. The boy at school. Jack. He saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns hopefully. Finally someone believes him. Vincent Merano stands by Jeff's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was on the slab.     Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen dead bodies.       Believe me, she was definitely dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom. Just go down there and check the place out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what grounds Paul?       Do you have any evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     But--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hesitates.    We sense his uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff snickers. Paul's beginning to realize how absurd this all sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collect or long distance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff snorts with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you hit a fucking kid. Then you attack Deane. And now you're telling me your dead girlfriend called you? What the fuck's going on? You're loosing it Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merano and Jeff shake their heads, looking at Paul as if he were crazy. Tom's voice softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you feel guilty but you've got to pull yourself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul slumps in the chair.       Rubs his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right.    But why won't he let me see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom signals to Merano and Jeff. Merano walks back to his desk. Jeff turns back to his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Paul. The funeral's tomorrow. You'll see her then. It'll help. It will give you closure. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun's low on the horizon. Eliot whistles softly to himself as he digs a grave. Working meticulously. Like everything else he does. Suddenly a SHADOW falls over Eliot. He calmly looks up. The sun's behind the figure. For a moment Eliot can't tell who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you could teach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot smiles. Gestures to Jack to come inside the grave. Jack steps back. The grave terrifies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a hole in the ground.   I'm digging it for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bryant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.   For Anna.   She belongs here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Because there's no life left in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack carefully considers Eliot's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? I have no choice. I'm the only one who can see all these corpses. Wandering the earth aimlessly. All they do is piss and shit. Suffocating us with their stench. Doing nothing with their lives. Taking the air away from those who actually want to live. I have to bury them all. I have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot holds up the shovel. Jack looks at him for a moment then reaches for the shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna watches Eliot brush an invisible speck off her mother's black dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did well this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talks with difficulty now. Her voice SLURRED and HOARSE. Her words muddled and rambling. Her eyes even more sunken. Her skin even more pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Paul came. You did the right thing. You let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be all right now?    Won't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot looks away. Doesn't reply. He drapes the dress over his arm, picks up a pair of shiny black shoes and moves over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to get dressed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's your funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot lifts Anna's arms and puts them through the sleeves of the dress. Her body's stiff and unyielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.   You only had three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He delicately turns her onto her side.    Buttons up the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to use your time well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna frowns. As if trying to remember something. Eliot gently lifts her legs. Pulls on a pair of black tights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to... I have so many regrets.     I have nothing but regrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him.   Suddenly realizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here isn't it?      To be judged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot picks up Anna's shoes.   Slips them onto her stiff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here to understand your life.       So you can finally be at peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted a different life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot picks up a nail-clipper. Gently holds Anna's hand as he carefully cuts her long nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why didn't you do anything about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what I did everything just stayed the same. I'd wake up. I'd shower. Sit in the same traffic everyday on my way to work. Go home. Go to sleep. Then wake again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stops clipping her nails.   Irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you really want from life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy? You all say you wanted to be happy. What does it mean Anna? To be happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Don't you understand? That's the whole point. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do! You're just too scared to admit it to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna turns away ashamed.   She knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it anymore.      I just want this to be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you want from life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT DID YOU WANT ANNA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I WANTED LOVE! OK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's stunned.   She's finally admitted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had love. Paul loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't understand. I was scared. I wanted to love but I didn't know how. I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a child... my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna struggles to pull together her thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a child. I learnt that love. That when you love someone. You get hurt. So I learned not to love. That way no one could ever hurt me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down at the slab.     Touches the cold marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was always pushing Paul away.      He thought I didn't love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the only one I ever loved. But I never told him that. And then he stopped loving me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stares at her intently.    Comes to a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you had another chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's puzzled. Eliot goes to the door and unlocks it. Moonlight floods in from upstairs. Washing it with a cold light. Anna doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?   Isn't this what you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot holds out his hand.   Anna takes it hesitantly and rises from the slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist drifts through the cemetery. Anna stands in the driveway. Pale and ghoulish in her black funeral dress and shiny black shoes. She starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna approaches her mother's house.    Paul opens the doo He's not surprised to see her. Beatrice stands just behind him.     A black shawl over h head and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the candlelight we can see the house is full of OLD WOMEN. Their faces deeply lined. Wearing identical black shawls. They stare at Anna, whispering in different rhythms. Unintelligible words undulating like an ANCIENT PRAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Beatrice lead Anna to the bed. As she lies down we realize the bed is full of BLACK SOIL. Clouds of ugly flies hang in the air. BUZZING noisily. The Old Women surround Anna in a tight circle. Leaning over her. Making her feel claustrophobic. She can smell their rotting breath as their prayers grow LOUDER. Through the chaos of words we begin to make out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna doesn't understand. Then she feels something in her mouth. Growing. Gagging her. The Women are SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna spits out... white maggots.     She gags again.   Cl her eyes. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's eyes snap open. She's still in the Prep Room. She steps back from the doorway. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were different. You all say you're scared of death. But the truth is you're more scared of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot switches off the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I'm dead. I'm glad it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits in his car. Staring out at the Funeral Home as he nervously smokes a cigarette. The light in Eliot's room goes off. Paul waits for a moment. Then gets out of his car. Stubs out his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul treads carefully along the side of the Funeral Home. It's a full moon. The trees rustle ominously in the wind. Casting eerie shadows against the dark house. He finds a window. Tries to open it. It won't budge. Just then he hears a noise in the bushes. He crouches down quickly. Listens hard. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE BUSHES
dialogues.text: Someone watches Paul tentatively move to another window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul strains to open the window when suddenly... he's caught in a circle of bright light. Paul turns quickly. A DARK FIGURE stands over him. Menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Figure lowers the flashlight.   It's Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON black earth.   A trowel digs into the soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back. Jack's just finished digging a hole in the flower bed. A shoebox beside him. He takes off the lid. The Chick trembles in the corner of the box. Jack slowly replaces the lid. Puts the box into the grave. He pushes the earth over it. The box jerks. We hear the faint RUSTLING of the Chick inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared. It's better this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot lies on his bed. Dressed in a dark suit. He hasn't slept at all. His eyes rimmed red. He checks the clock on the bedside table. It's 4.30am. He glances to the window. Dawn light seeps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot walks through the garden. A pair of small secaters in his hand. He stops by a bed of violets. Still covered in morning dew. He kneels and starts cutting the delicate flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna lies on the slab in her burial dress.   Her eyes clo Eliot enters the room. He doesn't lock the door behind him. Doesn't turn the lights on. Doesn't change into his mortician smock. He approaches the slab. The violets in his hand. Pulls over a chair and sits next to Anna. Places the violets on the steel trolley beside her. He looks at her intently. For the first time he seems uncertain. Vulnerable. As if questioning himself. After a while he suddenly gets up and heads towards the door. He's about to close the door behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes still closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot pauses.   Too confused to look back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Beatrice's face.    Her eyes closed. A HAND delicately powders her forehead. As if she's being prepared for her own funeral. We pull back. Beatrice, dressed in black, sits in front of a mirror. Diane applies her make-up. Beatrice opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, badly shaven, leans against the washbasin. Wearing a crumpled black suit. Staring vacantly in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna lies in a casket as Eliot arranges her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up smiling. Eliot positions her hands, entwining her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to look beautiful for your funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a SYRINGE and an ampoule of AMBER LIQUID. Fills the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glimpse the label: HYDRONIUM BROMIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will relax your muscles. Make your skin radiant. As if you were still alive. Just sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how they'll all remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see myself for the last time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot smiles.    Picks up a mirror.    Hands it to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks peaceful.    Beautiful.    Serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last part is the most difficult. You'll have to face it alone. But you'll be at peace soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna nods.    SIGHS deeply... her BREATH FOGS the mirror. She frowns. Touches the SMALL CIRCLE OF CONDENSATION on the glass. Looks up at Eliot in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot glances anxiously at the fogged mirror, then at Ann

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna. We've been through this before. You're just imagining--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot injects her in the side of the neck. Anna tries to raise her hand to push him away but she's too weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still clutching onto life. Don't give in to your fears. You're so close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's fading away.    Her hand drops limply to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you lie to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops struggling.    Stares blankly at us. Eliot looks at her for   a moment. Sadly. Regretfully. He picks up a Polaroid   camera. The flash explodes in a blinding white light.    He pulls out the Polaroid. Peels off the front and fans   it in the air. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...delicately closes Anna's eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's funeral is in progress.   Eliot stands by her casket. Surrounded by wreathes of tulips and lilies. Beatrice, in her wheelchair, in the front row. Diane beside her. A SCHOOLTEACHER sits behind them with Jack and other CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in me, even though they die, will live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Paul appear at the door.   Tom guides Paul to a seat near the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They that sleep in the earth will awake and shout for joy; and the earth will bring those long dead to birth again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna lies in an open casket. Her eyes closed.     She can hear the DISTORTED VOICE of the Priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have come here today to remember before God our sister Anna. To give thanks for her life.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNA'S FACE
dialogues.text: We see an almost imperceptible frown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot gestures to Beatrice. Diane wheels her to the caske Beatrice looks at Anna for a moment, then touches the violets in Anna's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violets. They were her favorite flowers. (turns to Eliot) How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violets just seemed appropriate somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next we see Mrs. Hutton at the casket. Then Jack. He stares at Anna's body before being moved on by the Schoolteacher. Finally Paul and Tom approach the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes out the ring box from his pocket. Gently slides the engagement ring onto Anna's stiff finger. Suddenly he looks alarmed. Turns quickly to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns back to Anna.    Tears prick his eyes. He touches her cheek again.    Finally accepting her death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her lips. Eliot watches him carefully. It's almost as if he's jealous. Jack notices Eliot's look then turns and stares at Paul. As Paul and Tom walk away Eliot closes the casket. Begins to screw down the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. We hear the screws TIGHTENING.      Anna's eye FLICKER OPEN then close again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Paul turns back sharply.      As if he sensed Anna's reaction inside the casket.      Tom gently stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) She's at peace now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul glances at the casket again, then reluctantly allows Tom to lead him away. Eliot tightens the last screw. His back to the room. Suddenly the screwdriver slips. Gashes his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drop of blood falls onto the polished wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stares at the blood for a moment. Takes out a pristine white handkerchief. Carefully wipes off the blood. Then places his hand on the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared. It's better this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot turns.   Signals to the PALLBEARERS standing nearby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pallbearers slowly lower Anna's casket into the open grave. The casket lurches as it settles in the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's eyes SNAP OPEN in terror. She tries to scream out. But only a SOFT RATTLING WHISPER escapes from her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEACHER throws a handful of earth onto the coffin. Jack steps up. Looks down curiously. As if he could sense Anna. Then slowly pours the soil from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have but a short time to live. Like a flower we blossom and then wither. In the midst of life we are in death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackness. Earth CLATTERS HEAVILY onto the wooden lid. Anna GASPS softly. Hyperventilating. The earth keeps falling. The sound becoming SOFTER with each shovelful. She struggles. Bangs her fists against the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grave's covered with a stone slab now. Votive candles flicker on top. In the b.g. MOURNERS head to their cars. Paul and Tom stand by the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're going to be OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Thanks Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom squeezes Paul's shoulder then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot carefully pins Anna's Polaroid to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan slowly across the other photographs we saw before. But now we look at them differently. In some faces there is the glimmer of life. In some a despairing pleading look. In others passive resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot moves towards the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark cemetery. In the distance flickering candles illuminate Anna's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine Anna. The whole world, your mother, your fiancГ©e, your friends. Everyone has buried you. They've placed a stone above your body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've said their good byes and gone back to their TV dinners and shopping malls. Thinking that this is never going to happen to them. Until it's their turn to be buried. Think about it Anna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...think about it while you still can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul unlocks his car. He's about to open the car door when he feels someone watching him. He turns. Jack's observing him carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she was alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said she was alive.     I just said I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul simply nods his head.        Too drained of emotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.   See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to fasten your seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods. Gets in his car.        Jack looks up at the Funeral Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stands in the window smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at Anna's wake.      PEOPLE talk quietly in small g Paul fills a glass with whiskey. Knocks it back in one. PEOPLE stare disapprovingly. WHISPERING to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you've had enough to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns. Eliot stands beside him.        Paul pours hi another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELDERLY COUPLE shake their heads and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran. We're at a wake.      You should show more respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she wasn't dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot's suddenly tired of Paul's allegations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Conran. You come to my Funeral Home, making wild accusations. You have no idea what happens when someone dies. What happens to their body. What happens to their soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Anna was alive after the accident? Maybe you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's still alive. You obviously don't believe a word I say. So why don't you go and find out for yourself Mr. Conran. Find out whether she's alive or dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul grabs Eliot by his lapels.   Shoves him against the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You twisted fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's SILENT. Everyone turns towards Paul.   Eliot whispers in Paul's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have much time left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Graham puts his hand on Paul's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   Paul. You're not well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes his hand away. Eliot shakes his head sadly. Everyone looks at Paul with pity as he runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sprints across the lawn to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul slips his key into the ignition.   His hand's shakin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot watches Paul's car ROAR OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't see a thing. But we can hear Anna's SHORT SHALLOW GASPS. And the sound of her nails desperately SCRATCHING at the coffin lid.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PAUL'S CAR. ROAD
dialogues.text: Paul drives fast. Accelerating then quickly braking as he weaves through heavy traffic. He comes up behind a slow Tractor-Trailer. Hits the HORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swerves into the middle of the road. There's a blind curve ahead... suddenly an SUV comes out of the corner. A bright white light sweeps through his car.     Paul's momentarily blinded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens his eyes. The ROAD'S EMPTY. No sign of any traffic. He's confused. The road was busy a moment ago. Just then flashing red and orange lights illuminate the car. Paul looks in his rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ON REARVIEW MIRROR
