dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE moves quickly towards him.     Blasts past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks through the front windshield.     Nothing.   H frowns. Where did the ambulance go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Funeral Home.   Bone white in the moonlight. The cemetery next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot's White Van sits by the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's car slams to a halt. He jumps out. In the distance the candles still burn on Anna's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul grabs a shovel by the grave. Starts digging. Then the shovel clunks against wood. He kneels down. Scrapes away the earth from the coffin. Then pulls open the lid. Anna's eyes are WIDE OPEN.     Her fingernails torn and b Paul grabs her shoulders. Pulls her out of the grave. body slumps limply like a rag doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna.   I'm here. Please God.     Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He desperately tries to revive her. But there's no life left in her. He's about to give up when... Anna's hand TWITCHES. Then after a moment she GASPS. Her eyes slowly focus on Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby.   Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gently helps Anna to her feet.    She looks round. Dazed. Turns back to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came back for you.     You're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Paul hears a rustling sound behind him. He turns. Nothing. He cocks his head slightly. There's something unnerving about the silence. Suddenly a CROW rises noisily into the air. Paul starts. Then watches, relieved, as the crow disappears into the dark sky. He turns back to Anna... she's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks round desperately. Runs between the stone crosses and statues of grieving angels searching for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then he glimpses SOMETHING MOVE among the trees. Runs over. Nothing. The cemetery is empty. The trees appear to SHIMMER for a moment. Paul shivers. Pulls his jacket around him. He doesn't notice the candles on Anna's grave behind him suddenly BLOW OUT.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ELIOT'S VAN. ROAD
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of a SIREN. The AMBULANCE blasts past. Eliot slides a disc into the player. CLASSICAL MUSIC fills the van. He strums the wheel. Enjoying the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul frantically runs into the parking lot.    Still calling out for Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the interior light in his car comes on.    Paul looks at the car nervously. He heads over to it.   Apprehensive.   Then... the car do slowly CLICKS open. Paul stops.   Stares into the car.   There's no one there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we see Paul approach the car. He peers in nervously. Then cautiously gets in. As he switches the interior light off, the camera moves slowly around him revealing... ... ANNA sitting in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns sharply.    Stunned.   Anna moves towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or do you want to make love here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna puts her fingers on Paul's lips. Clearly turned on. We hear the sound of something being UNZIPPED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting for you.    I missed you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of BLOOD trickles from his nose. He touches his lips. Looks blankly at the blood on his fingertips. A drop of blood falls on Paul's white shirt. It unfurls like a flower. Spreading out over the material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.   I always did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna hungrily kisses him. He responds passionately. Suddenly we hear a SHARP METALLIC SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna responds as if it was nothing strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only the scissors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the growing anxiety in Paul's eyes.    Anna's just interested in his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scissors?   What scissors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scissors. For your clothes.    Eliot just put them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls back.   Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're safe now. We're finally together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong bright light sweeps across Paul's face. Like the headlights of the car on the blind curve earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul blinks as he gradually gets used to the harsh light. Slowly the room comes into focus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot stands over Paul holding a pair of BLOODY SCISSORS. Paul looks down. His white shirt soaked with blood, the material sliced open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talks with difficulty.   His breath labored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a funeral home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack appears at Eliot's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a car accident. You swerved off the road. On the way to the cemetery. Hit a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Anna.    You buried her alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Mr. Conran. You never made it to the cemetery. You never saw Anna. You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's glazed eyes widen in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot speaks calmly.    Soothingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your skull was crushed. Your spinal cord pulverized. Your brain cells are slowly dying. Your body's already decomposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot sighs wearily.    He's had this conversation many times before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people.    You all say the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliot's voice, with each word, fades further and further away. Paul closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead.
